title.narrative: IMPROVED EDUCATION

description.narrative: Targeted Countries in the region adopt and/or implement strategies and policies to improve education, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: GRP1: Governments and regional institutions in MENA benefit from UNICEF technical and other support to achieve sustainable results for children and adolescents in development and humanitarian contexts.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Targeted Countries in the region adopt and/or implement strategies and policies to improve education

description.narrative: Addressing key challenges around access and learning, UNICEF MENARO spearheaded research on children and youth who are out of school, contributing to inclusive policies and additional resource mobilization, developed the LSCE framework as a basis for fundamental change of the learning agenda, meeting all targets set for the SP period. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/02/2018

title.narrative: Number of countries with nationally mainstreamed programmes to address equity in education at basic and post-basic levels

actual.value: 2017:14 MENA Countries with OOSCI mainstreamed interventions

title.narrative: Number of countries with nationally mainstreamed programmes to improve learning and measure learning outcomes

actual.value: 2017:15 MENA Countries engaged in the LSCE Initiative

title.narrative: 6 Syria crisis countries (Syria, Lebanon, Jordan, Iraq, Egypt, Turkey) supported in EiE response

actual.value: 2017:6 Countries (Syria, Lebanon, Jordan, Iraq, Egypt and Turkey) technically supported through existing coordination mechanisms

title.narrative: Number of countries engaged on education management information systems, policy development, and sector planning and reform processes

actual.value: 2017:10 (GPE countries, Morocco on INSAF, Algeria, Egypt, Iraq, Lebanon, Oman, Tunisia upstream engagement)
